item.title: manakauheads
item.description:
The Manakau heads, very pretty, beautiful views and some Mauri culture!

Use the map below to scroll around!

There is a channel between the 2 peices of land, the manukau heads and whatipu.

Drag the map around a bit to get a feel.

Figure 1: whatipu map

item.title: nelson
item.description:
Nelson was a really cool trip, we had quite a lot of driving, and the hills were quite treacherous, but as always it was worth it!

Use the map below to scroll around Nelson, we went to Motueka where we stayed a few nights, had some great walks, and there was also a really nice restaurant that we went to!

We were also at Able Tasman for some walking and awesome site seeing!

item.title: northhead
item.description:
North head is very close to auckland CBD but to get there by car takes some time due to the traffic being so congested! A lot of people will simply catch a ferry across the bay to get to Auckland CBD. There is a dedicated ferry service from Devon Port which is basically where North head is situated.

Use the map below to scroll through the area of North head, see how close it is to Auckland CBD!

item.title: picton
item.description:
Picton was a real supprise to us. It is very beautiful, small but it had everything!

We were here over a new year’s eve, and had some amazing fireworks in the bay.

Use the map below to scroll through the area of Christchurch! The map is interactive.

Figure 1: Picton map

item.title: rangitoto
item.description:
Rangitoto island is a volcano which emerged from the sea several centuries ago, about 600 years. We’ve been there a few times, and the black rocks are probably lava rocks! I assume that the volcano is dormant!

Use the map below to explore some of this island and it’s surrounds!

Figure 1: rangitoto island map

item.title: rotorua
item.description:
Rotorua island, somewhere in the Hauraki gulf!

This is a truely amazing island.

Use the map below to scroll through the area of Rotorua island!

It’s a bit further of a ferry ride from Auckland CBD, past Waiheke island.

Figure 1: rotorua island map

item.title: shakespeare
item.description:
Shakespeare Regional Park is another national park with many walks and bushes ! Not too far from Auckland CBD!

Use the map below to scroll through the area of Shakespeare Regional Park!

Figure 1: Shakespeare Regional Park map

Some of the awesome photos we took here! If you download any of these photos, they’ll download the original photo taken.

item.title: tiritiri
item.description:
Tiritiri Matangi island is an island sanctuary with some pretty rare birds

Use the map below to scroll through the area of Tiritiri Matangi Island!

This island is quite close to Shakespeare regional park

Figure 1: Tiritiri matangi island map

Some of the awesome photos we took here! If you download any of these photos, they’ll download the original photo taken.

item.title: waiheke
item.description:
Waiheke island is one of the larger islands close to Auckland , and accessible by ferry.

There are some great walks on Waiheke!

Use the map below to explore some of this beautiful island!

Figure 1: waiheke island map

item.title: whatipu
item.description:
Whatipu was supposed to be a gentle walk, we landed up having a serious walk, pulling ourselves up by chains!

There was a beautiful vista though, an amazing view!

Use the map below to scroll through the area of whatipu!

There is a channel between the 2 peices of land, whatipu and the manukau heads which is also very beautiful.

Drag the map around a bit to get a feel.
